Subtitle: Hey, ding-dongs. We figured out what's happened here.
You two are both named Eleanor Shellstrop.
Translation:
두 사람 모두 이름이
엘리너 셸스트롭이야

Subtitle: The day you died, you were both in Phoenix, Arizona,
shopping at the same grocery store.
The "real" Eleanor was attending a conference
Translation:
진짜 엘리너는 사형 제도에 관한
콘퍼런스에 참석 중이었고

Subtitle: on the death penalty, and you stopped by to pick up
food for a local homeless shelter.
And Fake Eleanor was there buying margarita mix
and a magazine called, "Celebrity Baby Plastic Surgery Disasters."
Translation:
'셀러브리티 베이비 성형 참사'
잡지를 사고 있었고요

Subtitle: Incredibly, you both died in the same 10,000th of a second,
Translation:
놀랍게도 두 사람은
같은 교통사고로 인해

Subtitle: in the same traffic accident, because Real Eleanor
Translation:
정확히 같은 순간에 사망했죠
진짜 엘리너가 가짜 엘리너를

Subtitle: was trying to save Fake Eleanor's life
by pushing you out of the way of the truck.
I guess you really botched that one, eh?
I did, and I am so, so sorry.
It's all good.
So, how did you not realize you had the wrong Eleanor?
Translation:
그러면 잘못된 엘리너라는 걸
어떻게 몰랐던 거죠?

Subtitle: Oh, we don't know what people look like,
Translation:
우리는 사람들이 어떻게
생겼는지는 모릅니다 이름과 인적 사항밖에 모르죠

Subtitle: only names and profiles. On Earth, they're just dots on a map.
Translation: 이름과 인적 사항밖에 모르죠 지도상의 점일 뿐이에요

Subtitle: Whatever, we got our wires crossed,
we picked up the wrong dot, blah, blah, blah, blah,
Point is, there are two Eleanors.
The nice, boring one is yours. The trash bag is ours.
Translation:
착하고 재미없는 건 당신 몫
쓰레기 봉지는 우리 몫

Subtitle: -Eh-- -So, trash bag, let's go.
Let's hit it. And, also...
I'm still waiting on that smile, gorgeous.
Translation:
아직 웃는 것도 못 봤네
웃어봐, 예쁜이

Subtitle: -[Michael] Trevor. -Where's that smile?
Translation:
- 미소 한번 보여줘
- 트레버, 협상 어때요?

Subtitle: Trevor, how about we negotiate? Give you something else?
Translation:
- 미소 한번 보여줘
- 트레버, 협상 어때요? 뭔가 좋은 게 있을지 모르죠

Subtitle: What in the world could you have that we would want?
Translation:
우리가 원하는 게
과연 여기 있을까?

Subtitle: All right, how about a unicorn?
Right? I bet you don't have one of those.
No, that is true, yeah.
-[laughs] -Might be fun to skin it alive, eat its raw flesh,
Translation:
산 채로 가죽을 벗겨서
회를 뜨고

Subtitle: maybe break off the horn, grind it up, snort it.
Translation:
뿔도 부러뜨려 갈아서
코로 흡입하면 좋겠군

Subtitle: Okay, let's keep talking. Yeah.
Fake Eleanor, a word?
It's just me, man. You can just say, "Eleanor."
Translation:
저 혼자 있으니
그냥 엘리너라고 불러요

Subtitle: Sorry, it just makes things easier.
Look, I'm not even sure how it would work for you to stay here
Translation:
이제 진짜 엘리너에 대해
알게 되었으니

Subtitle: now that we know there's a "real" Eleanor,
Translation:
당신이 여기 계속 있는 게
가능할지 모르겠지만

Subtitle: but in the meantime, stay on your toes.
Translation:
당신이 여기 계속 있는 게
가능할지 모르겠지만 그동안은 조신하게 있어요
트레버한테 넘어가지 말고요

Subtitle: Don't let Trevor get inside your head.
Translation:
그동안은 조신하게 있어요
트레버한테 넘어가지 말고요

Subtitle: Can I ask you something?
Why are you helping me?
Well, Chidi made a very good argument on your behalf,
Translation:
치디가 당신의 입장을
잘 대변해 주기도 했지만

Subtitle: but it's more than that. I truly believe that The Good Place is where you belong.
Translation:
무엇보다 나는 이곳이
당신이 있을 곳이라고 믿어요

Subtitle: You're part of our team.
Hi! Oh, you must be the new student Eleanor Shellstrop.
I'm Gloria, the senior class secretary.
Cool.
Well, welcome to Adobe High, home of the Scorpi-otes!
Translation:
아도비 고등학교에 온 걸 환영해
스콜피요테가 마스코트지!

Subtitle: Half the school wanted to be the Scorpions,
Translation:
학생 절반은 학교 마스코트로
스콜피온을 원했고

Subtitle: half wanted to be the Coyotes, so we compromised.
Translation:
다른 절반은 코요테를 원해서
양쪽 의견을 모두 수렴했어

Subtitle: Why don't I give you a tour after lunch?
Yeah, no thanks, mop-top.
Uh, sorry?
Don't need your help,
don't wanna sign your yearbook in, like, gel pen,
Translation:
네 졸업 앨범에 젤 펜으로
사인하고 싶지도 않고

Subtitle: don't wanna bedazzle our college essays, or whatever.
Translation:
네 대학 에세이 읽고
감동하고 싶지도 않아

Subtitle: I'm here for like six months, and I'm gonna fly solo.
Translation: 6개월만 있으면 졸업이니까 난 혼자 다닐 거야

Subtitle: Beat it, Gloria. She is, like, such a dork.
She, like, loves this school so much.
Why don't you come sit with us? We'll teach you which guys are cute
Translation: 이쪽으로 와서 우리랑 앉을래? 남자애들 누가 귀여운지

Subtitle: and which teachers are secretly pervs--
Yeah, that's a hard pass as well.
I don't wanna get chunky highlights,
make fun of nerds, and steal your mom's flavored vodka.
Translation:
멍청한 애들 놀리면서
엄마 보드카나 훔치고 싶지는 않아

Subtitle: I get your whole "mean girl" thing, and I'm all set with it, thanks.
Translation:
날라리 놀이하는 건 알겠는데
난 관심 없어, 고마워

Subtitle: In fact...
Listen up, everyone.
I'm Eleanor, I'm new here, and as a blanket statement for everyone,
Translation:
나는 새로 온 엘리너야
모두에게 확실히 말해두자면 "스콜피요테" 나는 너희가 만들어 놓은
무리에는 전혀 관심이 없어

Subtitle: I don't wanna be a part of whatever little group you've formed
Translation:
나는 너희가 만들어 놓은
무리에는 전혀 관심이 없어 어차피 따분한 건
다 마찬가지니까

Subtitle: because they're all equally lame.
Everybody cool? Great.
Hey, that was really cool, the way you told all those posers--
Translation:
아까 진짜 굉장했어 - 센 척하는 애들한테...
- 됐어

Subtitle: No.
[Tahani] Michael, welcome. How can I help you?
Well... If I'm going to save Fake Eleanor,
I need some help negotiating. I don't even know what to offer.
Translation:
협상을 해야 하는데
뭘 제안해야 할지 모르겠어요

Subtitle: I mean, what do you get somebody who wants to eat a unicorn?
Translation:
유니콘을 먹겠다는 사람에게
뭘 제안해야 하죠?

Subtitle: A unicorn bib, yes! No, no, uh, unicorn holders,
you know, like, like corn holders, but for unicorns?
Translation:
옥수수 먹을 때 쓰는 것처럼요
그걸 유니콘용으로?

Subtitle: Perhaps, it'd be better
if we just move away from the unicorn thing altogether.
[sighs] No, you're right, you're right.
And anyway, there's a bigger problem.
The Bad Place Crew, they're all terrible bullies,
and they outnumber me. They even have their own Bad Janet. I'll show you.
Translation:
머릿수도 훨씬 많죠
나쁜 재닛도 있어요, 보여드릴게요

Subtitle: Bad Janet?
-[tone sounds] -What?
Bad Janet, uh, where is the nearest café?
Translation:
나쁜 재닛, 가장 가까운
카페가 어디죠?

Subtitle: Oh, um, that's a good question.
It's up your mom's butt, you fat dink.
Translation:
네 엄마 방뎅이 속에 있어
모자란 자식

Subtitle: -[tone sounds] -What is even the purpose of a Janet who behaves in such a manner?
Translation:
저런 재닛이 필요한 이유가
도대체 뭘까요?

Subtitle: Unclear, but the... The point is
Translation:
그거야 모르죠, 중요한 건
내가 부정적 감정을

Subtitle: I never have to deal with negative emotion of any sort.
Translation:
그거야 모르죠, 중요한 건
내가 부정적 감정을 겪어보질 못해서
도움이 필요해요, 타하니

Subtitle: I could use some backup, Tahani.
Oh, Michael, of course. Why don't you just bring them all here?
Translation:
물론 도와드릴게요
여기로 모두 데리고 오면 어때요?

Subtitle: Surely, this magnificent house will placate them.
Translation:
이렇게 아름다운 집에서는
평안을 얻을 거예요

Subtitle: Oh, perfect, perfect. I'll be right back.
[Eleanor] Well, here's... Your house.
It's beautiful, I love Icelandic primitive design.
Translation:
정말 아름답네요
고대 북유럽 디자인 정말 좋아해요

Subtitle: I kind of wish it had a clown nook, oh!
There it is.
Here's the bedroom. It's kind of hard to get up
on this dumb ledge though, it's like--
Translation:
이 턱을 올라가는 게
좀 짜증 나는데...

Subtitle: You have got to be forking kidding me.
Hey, Fake Eleanor, we used this same clown painting
Translation:
가짜 엘리너
배드 플레이스의 너희 집에도

Subtitle: to decorate the room you were supposed to live in down there.
I swear to Bieber.
Wait, what was your house like?
Well, I was living in what I assume is Eleanor's worst nightmare.
Translation:
아마도 엘리너가 가장
싫어하는 환경이었던 것 같아요

Subtitle: Every day was basically one endless baby shower
for a woman I didn't know.
Translation:
제가 알지도 못하는
사람의 베이비 샤워였죠

Subtitle: But also, somehow, I had to organize it.
Translation:
제가 알지도 못하는
사람의 베이비 샤워였죠 그걸 제가 주관해야 했어요

Subtitle: And, if I didn't remember everyone's name, I got a very strong electric shock.
Translation: 참석한 사람 이름을 못 외우면 엄청 센 전기 충격을 받았어요

Subtitle: Yep, that was my pitch.
And, then at night, it was pretty classic torture.
Uh, flying piranhas, lava monsters, college improv,
Translation:
날아다니는 피라냐나 용암 괴물
대학생 즉흥 코미디 같은 거

Subtitle: and there was always jazz music playing.
Ugh, I hate jazz.
Every jazz song is, like, 40 minutes long. It's like, we get it.
You can blow on a trumpet. Wrap it up, Elton John.
Translation:
트럼펫 잘 부는 거 알겠으니까
이제 그만하라고, 엘튼 존

Subtitle: Famously a piano player.
I don't mean to be a bother, but could I possibly get some water
Translation:
실례가 되지 않는다면 물하고
입안에서 거미로 변하지 않는 아무 음식이나 얻을 수 있을까요?

Subtitle: and whatever food doesn't turn to spiders in your mouth?
Oh, of course, so sorry. Let's get some dinner.
Translation:
네, 물론이죠
이제 저녁 먹도록 해요

Subtitle: Yeah, we'll all go. Perfect double date.
Two losers, a trash bag, and a demon.
Translation:
루저 둘과
쓰레기 봉지, 악마가 함께

Subtitle: Let's hit it.
All right, Michael, we're going to ply them with delicious food and drink,
Translation: 먼저 완벽한 음료수와 음식으로 감동시키고 나서

Subtitle: and then we're going to subtly segue into negotiation.
They're sure to be in a good mood. Everything is absolutely beautiful.
Translation: 다들 기분이 좋아 보이네요 모든 게 정말 아름답군요

Subtitle: This sucks, dude.
Yeah, this food, uh, blows.
Yo, Good Janet.
-[tone sounds] -Hi, there.
Oh, gimme some jalapeño poppers.
Sure, quick question, what is a "jalapeño"?
Also, what is a "poppers"? Also, what is "jalapeño poppers"?
Oops! Sorry, guys. See, in the confusion,
Janet got rebooted, so she hasn't quite uploaded
Translation:
재닛이 재부팅되었어요
그래서 전에 알던 것도

Subtitle: all of the info she usually knows.
That's hilarious.
She's almost as stupid as people.
Oh, hey now, come on. Let's not insult people, please.
Translation:
우리 모두
인간은 모욕하지 말기로 해요

Subtitle: [imitating Michael] I'm Michael, I love idiot humans!
I got to admit, that does sound like me.
"I got to admit, that does sound like me."
Oh, nailed it again.
Go get me a drink.
Yes, of course.
Ah, man, this is gonna make a primo dump later on.
Translation:
이걸 먹고 나면
화장실에서 금똥을 싸겠어

Subtitle: Well, that looks delicious. What is that?
Oh, it's Tom Yum Goong soup. It reminds me of when I was in Thailand
Translation:
아, 똠얌꿍 수프예요
이걸 먹으면 태국에서 인신매매 희생자들을
구조할 때가 생각나죠

Subtitle: rescuing victims of human trafficking.
Oh, that sounds so good. I mean, the soup, not the...
Human trafficking.
Oh, and I think your grilled eggplant looks so good.
Translation:
그쪽 구운 가지도
정말 맛있어 보이는데요

Subtitle: Should we...
-[both] Splitsies? -Yeah!
I can't believe you thought you could pretend to be Real Eleanor.
Translation:
네가 진짜 흉내를 내고
살 수 있을 줄 알았어?

Subtitle: She's like a perfect ball of light, and you're like a... Wet pile of mulch.
Translation:
저쪽은 환한 불빛 같고
넌... 젖은 거름 더미 같잖아

Subtitle: Someone made a person out of wet mulch and leaves
Translation:
누군가 젖은 거름이나
죽은 달팽이 같은 쓰레기로

Subtitle: and, like, dead slugs, and that's you.
Whatever, it's easy when you're just born perfect.
Translation:
금수저로 태어났을 텐데
어려운 게 뭐가 있었겠어요?

Subtitle: My parents were both dirt bags who split up when I was eight.
Translation:
우리 부모는 둘 다 형편없었고
내가 8살 때 이혼했어요

Subtitle: I don't mean to eavesdrop,
but did you say your parents got a divorce?
Yeah, and that kind of thing really changes a person.
Translation:
네, 사람들은 그런 일로
많은 변화를 경험하죠

Subtitle: I mean, that trauma... It can explain away
Translation:
그 트라우마가
한 사람의 행동 방식에

Subtitle: a lot of behavior.
Oh, of course.
Your parents are still together, I guess.
Oh, actually, I'm not sure. I never met my birth parents.
Translation:
사실 저는 몰라요
친부모님을 만난 적이 없거든요

Subtitle: They put me in an empty fish tank
and abandoned me at a train station in Bangladesh.
-[groans] -Luckily, I was found
and adopted by a very nice couple, the Shellstrops...
Translation:
셸스트롭이라는 아주
훌륭한 가정에 입양이 되었어요

Subtitle: Oh, thank God.
But then they died when I was four...
-Bird flu. -That's awful.
Translation:
제가 4살 때 조류 독감으로
돌아가셨어요 - 엄청나군요
- 고아원은 불에 탔고

Subtitle: Anyway, orphanage burned down, yadda, yadda, yadda.
Translation:
- 엄청나군요
- 고아원은 불에 탔고 저는 미국으로 와서

Subtitle: Made my way to America, yadda, yadda, yadda.
Learned English from watching Seinfeld,
put myself through law school, and here I am.
Huh. And, I'm sorry, what...
What is it you said happened to you?
The same thing that happens to half of all kids in America? [laughs]
And for you to have gone through all that, and to end up where you did, it is just...
Translation: 그런 일을 겪고도 이렇게 훌륭하게 성장했다니...

Subtitle: It's just amazing.
Oh, man, these horn-dogs are vibing like mofos.
Translation:
이 둘 지금 완전히
정신을 못 차리네

Subtitle: Am I right, Fake Eleanor?
Please, stop calling me that.
Oh, you got it, third wheel. [laughs]
Yeah, that wine's no good. I'm sending it back.
Hey, Janet.
You look sad.
People keep asking me questions that I don't know the answers to.
Translation:
사람들이 내가 모르는 것들을
자꾸 물어보네요

Subtitle: That was my whole life on Earth.
You know, it doesn't matter if you know things.
All that matters is what's in your heart.
Thanks, Jianyu. I mean, it does matter if I know things,
because I'm an informational delivery system,
and I don't have a heart, but thanks.
Translation:
그리고 전 마음도 없고요
그래도 고마워요

Subtitle: Jianyu, I know usually you ask me questions,
Translation:
지안유, 보통은 당신이
제게 질문을 하지만 제가 질문을 해도 될까요?

Subtitle: but can I ask you a question?
-Sure. -What are jalapeño poppers?
Oh, I know this one!
Okay, they're deep fried jalapeños filled with cheese.
Translation:
치즈를 채워 넣고 튀긴
할라페뇨 고추예요

Subtitle: One time, at a Buffalo Wild Wings in Jacksonville,
Translation:
예전에 잭슨빌에서
버펄로 와일드 윙을 갔었어요 주유소에 있는 허접한 데 말고
정말 근사한 곳으로요

Subtitle: but the nice one, not the one above the gas station,
Translation:
주유소에 있는 허접한 데 말고
정말 근사한 곳으로요

Subtitle: I ate 50 of them in two minutes.
Everyone at the hospital was so impressed.
Got it. Thanks, Jianyu.
You're welcome.
Why did you do that?
Because you're the only person here that's nice to me.
Okay.
Anyone up for a little, uh, icebreaker?
You know, I once did trust falls with Barry Diller,
Translation:
한번은 베리 딜러와
트러스트 폴을 했는데

Subtitle: and it was the beginning of a lifelong friendship.
And then, once we trust each other, then we can discuss
Translation:
우리도 서로 신뢰한다면
가짜 엘리너에 대한

Subtitle: making a deal for Fake Eleanor.
This sucks. How do you guys eat without listening to hard-core porn?
Translation:
재미없어, 포르노 없이
어떻게 음식을 먹는 거지?

Subtitle: Oh, come on, this is The Good Place, you can do anything you want.
Translation:
이곳은 굿 플레이스입니다
원하는 건 뭐든 할 수 있어요

Subtitle: What about throwing a rager and totally trashing this place?
Translation:
그러면 여기를 한번
박살 내보는 건 어때?

Subtitle: Woo-hoo. Yeah, I'd be into that.
We could totally go to town.
You know, I actually don't think that's such a good idea.
Let's party!
♪ Who let the dogs out? ♪
Oh, my God!
So, um, Chidi tells me that he's teaching you about ethics.
Yeah, actually, we've had some interesting
Translation:
네, 꽤 흥미롭고
깊이 있는 시간이었죠

Subtitle: and in-depth classes. He taught me about Plato
-and Socrates, Immanuel Kant-- -Yeah, cool, shut up.
Let's cut to the chase here. You two go to Poundtown?
Translation:
본론으로 들어가지
둘은 재미 좀 보나?

Subtitle: Poundtown, bro. You two bang it out?
She hot for teach? Did you pork the dork?
C'mon, girl, dish me dem dirty deets.
I assure you, our relationship was "teacher-student," nothing more.
Chidi, you don't have to explain anything to me.
Whatever happened before I arrived is none of my business.
Translation:
제가 오기 전에 있었던 일은
저와 관계없는 일이니까요

Subtitle: Hey, I'd love to see the rest of the neighborhood.
Um, yes, it's incredible.
There's an amazing library,
there's a beautiful, piranha-free lake.
Translation:
훌륭한 도서관도 있고
피라냐가 없는 아름다운 호수도 있죠

Subtitle: [chuckles] Well, please, show me everything.
Translation: 아름다운 호수도 있죠 전부 보고 싶어요

Subtitle: You ready, Eleanor?
I've seen it all already. You guys go ahead.
Translation:
저는 모두 봤으니
두 분 가보세요

Subtitle: You'd rather be alone with him?
Fire in the hole. Watch your heads, ladies.
My dudes tend to boomerang around the room.
Translation:
내 발톱 친구들이
사방으로 튀고 난리네

Subtitle: Yeah, I mean, I don't need to walk around and nerd out about old books. I'm good.
Translation:
오래된 책들이나 찾아
일부러 돌아다니면서 시간 낭비할 생각은 없어요

Subtitle: Okay.
Hey, a bunch of us are gonna go see Spider-Man 2 tonight.
Translation:
오늘 애들이랑 나가서 '스파이더맨 2' 볼 건데
같이 갈래?

Subtitle: Do you want to come?
They made a second Spider-Man?
What is there left to say?
Sure, whatever, I'm in.
Cool, okay, well, I'll get tickets
for the eight of us, and you can just pay me back in cash.
Translation: 그럼 내가 표 8장 예매할게 나중에 나한테 현금으로 줘

Subtitle: So, you can get all the points on your credit card,
Translation: 너 혼자서 신용 카드 포인트 다 챙기려고?

Subtitle: and the rest of us get screwed?
-No way. -No, it's just so
we can all get tickets before they sell out.
Translation:
매진되기 전에
다 사려고 그러는 거잖아

Subtitle: Do you want to buy them?
So you guys can never pay me back, and I'll be out like 80 bucks? Nice try.
Translation:
그럼 너흰 절대 안 갚고
나 혼자 손해 보라고? 시도는 좋았지만
내 표는 내가 사겠어

Subtitle: I'll buy my own ticket.
Translation:
시도는 좋았지만
내 표는 내가 사겠어

Subtitle: The rest of the group can do whatever they want.
Where did she end up?
Bought it with points, baby. My points.
I think I need to find a new place to live.
Translation: 나 이사 가야 할 것 같아

Subtitle: -[electronic music playing] -Oh... No, no, no, no.
Don't... Don't...
[chuckles] All right.
Want a bump?
No, thank you, I don't use cocaine.
Oh, it's not cocaine, idiot. We're snorting time.
Translation:
코카인 아니야, 머저리
시간을 흡입하는 거야

Subtitle: Sorry... you're snorting the concept of time?
Yeah, it'll fork you up.
Yo, monk dude, you know how to tap a keg?
Translation:
거기, 스님
맥주통 딸 줄 아나?

Subtitle: -Karaoke time! -[Dana] Whoo!
Dana, baby, what do you wanna do?
Okay, Mussolini's speech? Ooh, the Mel Gibson rant?
Translation:
무솔리니 연설? 아니면
멜 깁슨 불평하는 거?

Subtitle: -That's a classic. -Classic...
Ooh! Let's do the Nixon tapes.
Translation:
- 고전이지
- 그래 - 닉슨 도청 테이프로 하자!
- 좋아!

Subtitle: -That's my jam! -Yeah!
[Nixon's voice] "What you always have to remember about the Irish is they get mean.
"Virtually every Irish I've known gets mean when he drinks."
Translation:
'내가 아는 모든 아일랜드 사람은
술을 마시면 고약해지지'

Subtitle: Michael, tell them to stop.
Oh, I think I made it pretty clear that I don't approve.
Translation:
용납하지 않겠다는 의견은
충분히 표현한 것 같아요

Subtitle: -Hey, idiot. Dance. -You got it.
[Nixon's voice] "Oh, it's about damn time that the Jew in America realizes
he's an American first and a Jew second."
[laughs] I lighted him on fire, and he never spoke again.
Translation:
내가 몸에 불을 붙였더니
다시는 말을 못 했지

Subtitle: You know, maybe I'm not as great as Real Eleanor,
but I'm better than I used to be.
I'm medium-good.
Why haven't you forkers invented a medium place?
Translation: 난 중간 정도는 좋은 사람이라고요 미디엄 플레이스는 왜 없어요?

Subtitle: Look, I know you've been trying to become a "better person,"
Translation:
네가 '더 나은 사람'이 되려고
노력한 건 알겠어

Subtitle: I mean, you didn't want to get caught. I get it.
But, I read your file... You don't belong here.
Translation:
하지만 네 파일을 봤는데
넌 여기 어울리지 않아

Subtitle: I mean, she spent her weekends breaking up dog fighting rings.
Translation:
저 엘리너는 투견장 문을
닫으려고 몇 주 동안 노력했어

Subtitle: You once saw a meter maid writing you a ticket,
Translation:
너는 주차 단속원이
네 차에 티켓 끊는 거 보고

Subtitle: and you barked like a dog till she ran away.
Translation:
그 사람이 도망갈 때까지
개처럼 짖어댔잖아

Subtitle: I mean, honestly, you'll be happier in The Bad Place.
Translation:
너는 배드 플레이스가
더 잘 맞을 거야

Subtitle: I mean, don't get me wrong, you'll be miserable.
We will torture you, but you'll also be happier.
Translation:
우리가 고문도 할 거니까
하지만 더 행복할 거라고

Subtitle: Because you won't have to keep trying to fit in somewhere
you just don't belong.
All right!
Let's go.
Okay, hold on, I have to ask, is this thing gonna happen?
Translation:
좋았어, 잠깐
우리는 어떻게 안 될까?

Subtitle: -You and me? -Ew, no, gross.
Okay, you know I had to ask, babe.
[Michael] Oh, Tahani, I'm so sorry.
I will obviously clean all of this up.
I don't care about the house, Michael.
I'm just upset that you let them walk all over you.
Translation:
이 사람들이 맘대로 하는데도
그냥 두면 어떡해요

Subtitle: I know... They're the only thing in the Universe that scares me.
Translation:
내가 무서워하는 건
전 우주에 이 사람들뿐이에요

Subtitle: I know what I have to do.
I just have to be... More accommodating.
Offer them everything they want, give in to all of their demands,
and then they'll have to respect me.
No, you need to stand up for yourself.
Translation:
아니에요, 자신을 위해
더 당당해져야 해요

Subtitle: I'm going to tell you the same thing that I told
Mark Zuckerberg right before he ousted Eduardo Saverin.
Translation:
내가 마크 저커버그에게
해준 얘기를 그대로 해줄게요

Subtitle: You are smart, you are capable, and the time has come to hit "unfriend."
Translation:
당신은 똑똑하고 능력 있으니
이제 '친구 끊기'를 누르고 '더 페이스북'이 아닌
그냥 '페이스북'이라고 해요

Subtitle: I also told Mark to lose the "the". Just "Facebook."
That was me.
Oh, my head.
Here, drink this.
How am I hung over? I thought there were no hangovers here.
Translation:
나 왜 이러죠?
여긴 숙취가 없는 줄 알았는데

Subtitle: Well, The Bad Place Crew requested that the hangover filter be turned off.
Translation:
배드 플레이스 사람들이
숙취 필터를 꺼달라고 했어요 자기들은 그게 좋다고

Subtitle: They like them.
So, Michael said we're meeting at Tahani's place in an hour
for a negotiation session. We'll walk over together?
You don't have to come, man. I'm good.
Just hang out with Real Eleanor and name constellations
Translation:
진짜 엘리너랑 다니면서
별자리에 서로의 이름을 붙이거나

Subtitle: after each other, or whatever it is nerds do.
Translation:
다른 따분한 일을 하면서
놀든가 해요

Subtitle: I'm fine on my own.
Yeah, Eleanor, just because we have a new guest in the house
doesn't mean I'm not still gonna be there for you.
Translation:
내가 당신을
응원하지 않는 건 아니에요

Subtitle: I'm in this. We're a team.
So, you've been temping for us for a year now,
and we want to bring you aboard permanently.
We think you'd be a great addition to the team.
Translation: 우리 팀에 잘 어울리실 것 같네요

Subtitle: Yeah... No. I'm good.
You're turning it down?
I just don't think I'm really one of you guys.
Translation:
제가 여기 어울리는 것
같지가 않아서요

Subtitle: You're all obsessed with this place, man.
You love working here and talking about working here,
and you all hang out like some kind of cult.
Translation:
무슨 종교 집단처럼
밖에서도 어울려 다니고요

Subtitle: We hang out after work because we're friends.
Translation:
일 끝나고 만나는 건
친구기 때문에 그런 거예요

Subtitle: I know. It's weird.
If this is how you really feel, I think I have to fire you.
Translation:
그게 솔직한 의견이라면
해고해야 할 것 같군요

Subtitle: Severance pay. Love it.
Good looking out, boss.
Peace!
You need me to lie to old people
and scare them into buying fake allergy medicine.
I get it, man. Which one's my desk?
That one, over there.
All you gotta do is hit your minimal sales target every week.
Cool. And you guys don't have any lame, mandatory office hangouts, right?
Translation:
좋아요, 여기서는 지루한 강제 회식 같은 건
없는 거죠?

Subtitle: Hell no.
Some people go out for a drink after work,
Translation:
가끔 퇴근 후에 나가서
한잔하는 사람들이 있고

Subtitle: and I like to run the occasional group drill
Translation:
때가 되면 증거를
얼마나 빨리 없애는지

Subtitle: to see how fast we can shred evidence, but that's it.
Most days, you'll be able to avoid even talking to another person here.
Translation:
대부분은 다른 사람들과
얘기할 일조차 없을 거예요

Subtitle: Perfect. Happy to be a part of the not-team.
Translation:
이런 콩가루 집단에
참여하게 되어 기쁘네요

Subtitle: It'll be a pleasure not hanging out with you.
Translation:
함께 어울릴 필요 없어서
정말 다행입니다

Subtitle: All right, let's begin negotiations.
Now, we would like to discuss various trades that we could--
Oh, yeah, we're not negotiating.
See, Fake Eleanor and I, we bro-ed down pretty hard last night.
Translation:
가짜 엘리너와 나는 어젯밤
서로에 대한 믿음을 확인했거든

Subtitle: -We hooked up. -No, we didn't.
Yeah, but who are they gonna believe... me or a woman? [laughs]
Translation:
이 사람들이 내 말을 믿을까?
여자 말을 믿을까?

Subtitle: Point is, she knows that she doesn't belong here, and she's giving up.
Translation:
아무튼 저 여자도 알아 자기가 여기 안 어울리는 거
이제 포기할 거야

Subtitle: Is this true, Fake Eleanor? Are you giving up?
Translation:
그게 사실인가요? 가짜 엘리너 양
포기하는 거예요?

Subtitle: Yeah, of course she is. She knows this place isn't for her.
Translation:
당연하지, 여기가
자기 자리 아닌 거 알아

Subtitle: Let's go, ding-dong. Come on.
No, I'm not leaving.
Oh, come on, sweetheart, we've been through this.
You know you don't belong here.
You're right. I don't...
But, I want to.
I used to never want to be a part of any group,
Translation:
이전에는 한 번도 어디에
속하고 싶지 않았었지만

Subtitle: but I'm a different person now,
Translation:
지금은 달라요
날 도와줬던 누군가로 인해

Subtitle: because of the person who helped me,
Translation:
지금은 달라요
날 도와줬던 누군가로 인해 지금은 그 사람처럼
되고 싶다고요

Subtitle: and I want to be like him.
I want to be like all the people who are here.
You can, Eleanor.
Thanks, Real Eleanor.
Hey, if you two aren't gonna make out, just shut up.
Translation:
둘이 사귀려는 거 아니라면
그만 닥치시지

Subtitle: Look, if you don't come with us,
we're gonna have to turn this matter over to Shawn.
Oh, oh, no! Shawn, really?
Who's Shawn?
He's the wise, eternal Judge who sits on high,
Translation:
우리 두 세계 사이의
모든 분쟁을 해결하는

Subtitle: has the final say on all disputes between our two realms.
And his name is Shawn?
Okay, look, I don't want Shawn involved either.
So, how about you blow us away with an offer, so we can end this.
Translation:
그러니까 놀라 자빠질 만한
제안을 해봐

Subtitle: Okay...
Here's my offer.
You get nothing!
We're not letting Fake Eleanor go, and we're not giving you anything.
Translation:
가짜 엘리너도 여기 있을 거고
아무것도 주지 않을 겁니다

Subtitle: Get him, Michael!
You can summon every evil creature you have,
Translation:
당신이 어떤 악마를 소환하든
어떤 무기를 가져오든

Subtitle: every weapon in your arsenal, every four-headed flying bear.
Translation:
머리가 넷 달린
날아다니는 곰을 데려오든... 거긴 그런 게 있대요
우린 포기하지 않을 거예요

Subtitle: They have them down there. But, we are not giving up.
Translation:
거긴 그런 게 있대요
우린 포기하지 않을 거예요 엘리너는 굿 플레이스에

Subtitle: I believe that Eleanor belongs in The Good Place.
Translation:
엘리너는 굿 플레이스에 어울리는 사람이라고 생각하니까
내가 틀렸다면

Subtitle: If I'm wrong, you can take her to The Bad Place
Translation:
어울리는 사람이라고 생각하니까
내가 틀렸다면 당신이 그녀를 배드 플레이스로
데리고 가서

Subtitle: and punish her all you want, just really go to town on her.
Translation:
당신이 그녀를 배드 플레이스로
데리고 가서 맘대로 벌을 줘도 좋아요

Subtitle: Gah, gah, gah. Easy, buddy, easy.
But, she's staying here.
Now, all of you...
Get the fork out of my neighborhood.
[chuckles] You're on borrowed time, Fake Eleanor.
Enjoy it while it lasts. Let's roll, dummies.
Let's get one drink for the road.
-[Dana] Bye. -[Alexis] Did you guys hear any of that?
Translation:
- 안녕
- 방금 저 사람 얘기 들었어?

Subtitle: Oh, my...
-[Tahani] Bravo, Michael, really. -[applauding]
Hello, Jianyu.
You got sloppy. I found your junk food all over the house,
Translation:
많이 풀어졌네요
아까 불량 식품도 찾았어요 사방에 널렸더라고요
그리고 어젯밤에 보니까

Subtitle: and then, last night,
you knew how to tap a keg.
So, I thought I would come in here
Translation:
맥주통 따는 법도 알던데 그래서 내가
'명상실'을 좀 조사하다가

Subtitle: and investigate your little "meditation" den.
And, what I found was this.
Now, I don't know who you are,
but I do know that you're not a Buddhist monk.
So, let's chat, shall we?
